thea is an enjoyable survival game that uses a hex based grid for interaction it is not a 4x title and while it may look like civ or similar titles it does not play like one other reviews give a much better gameplay break down im mainly here to say that i loved the wealth of slavic mythology presented in the game and encourage people with an interest in slavic legends and myths to give it a go if they also enjoy survival titles

this is a beautiful game that will appeal to those who enjoy tactical fantasy role playing games and to those who enjoy 4x games  its an intriguing hybrid  the art is nice and the challenge system including combat and other challenges has a fun tactical dimension that builds on the emerging abilities of your characters
absolutely wonderful i still come back to this game all these years later for the addictive storytelling voice acting 4x chooseyourownadventure roguelike rpg set in slavic mythology highly recommend
many hours of replayability with different gods and different difficulties
great game it definitely has battle brothers vibes and convinces by gameplay immersion and difficultly

neat turn based exploration game with city building elements  there is basic farming you just have to assign somebody to farm none of that clicking endlessly to get crops different buildings gods and other aspects  good fighting and you can have it done auto
this is probably my favourite of all the 4x genre games that i have played  overall score 8510

control your village send exploring parties farm resources build stuff uncover mysteries of the fallen world battle hostile monsters and bandits and survive choose gods to get buffs and make them stronger by playing more and more under their banner

some games from 2010 are as good as new this is not the case when there are both rpg and strategic elements it is very important to immerse the player in them gradually perhaps making an initial mission where a small group of people tries to survive and establish a settlement when you start with a dozen people at once its not very smooth to deal with all the necessary micromanagement
liked it not muc hto say first time seen such battles in 4x type was interesting going to try thea 2 now
extremely fun game although the number of playthroughs expected to unlock stuff is kinda obscene nothing else like it really

a beautiful game with endless replayability each village you settle feels unique and taking what you learned on prior runs and exploring new ones is delightful the rpg elements are engrossing and the challenge of survival rewarding a true gem of a game

fortunately in this game new villagers appear much more than the second game that is good because combat takes a high toll when even injuries often slowly end with dying the crafting feeding arming clothing and supplying expeditions are all interesting as is technology and village development the storyline is the same basicalljy but replayability comes by playing different gods or progressing with a single god 70100

i fucking love this game

resource management strategy random encounters excellent game if only i could find more like it after hundreds of hours the narration gets repetitive but i love the creativity and story lines i also appreciate the ability to select a deity which changes the main guest gameplay  bonuses i just downloaded the dlc  excited to add more content to one of my favourite games

this is a great game combining different concept pretty well you choose how to solve your challenges you can be sneaky smart charming use magic or brute force all challenges are resolved using a card system were the cards are your people and have stats that are influence by their class equipment events how you chose to solved them and the buildings you chose to build in you town lots of events encounters and an interesting back story for each gods  i really enjoyed this game
excellent game just just brilliant

if you have relatively low expectations prepare to be delightfully surprised if you think this game will be a aaa title prepared to be disappointed  there is lots to love about thea the awakening and the only real gripe is the sad turnbased card game combat system which fortunately you can skip so you can enjoy all the other aspects of this game which are genuinely quite endearing  once you have played it through consider getting an additional events pack from nexus mods
one of the best slavic games

how does this game have a longer loading time than skyrim whether you can win this game is entirely based on your start location but do get to choose your start location of course not so you have to keep restarting the game over and over again till you get a viable start location but this can take hours because of the insane loading times i actually think it might have been quicker to download the game than to load it

addictive as fuck
